intro: Anil brassii, commonly known as the African violet, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the Gesneriaceae family and is characterized by its thick, fleshy leaves and showy, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows as a herbaceous perennial, often forming a rosette of foliage. Its flowers come in a variety of colors, including purple, pink, white, and red, and are highly popular as ornamental plants. Anil brassii thrives in humid, well-drained soil and requires indirect sunlight for optimal growth.
